# beget_postgresql_configurations (Data Source)

List available PostgreSQL service configurations (tariffs). Use this to look up configuration_id for beget_postgresql_service.

## Filters
- `region`: limit configurations to a specific location (e.g., `ru1`)
- `version`: limit to a specific PostgreSQL version (e.g., `16.4`)

## Fields
Map keys are configuration IDs. Each entry exposes `id`, `region`, `type` (cloud service type),
`price_day`, `price_month` (roubles), `cpu_count`, `disk_size`, `memory` (MB),
`version`, and `display_version`.

## Example Usage
```terraform
# Fetch all PostgreSQL configurations
data "beget_postgresql_configurations" "all" {}

output "configuration_ids" {
  value = keys(data.beget_postgresql_configurations.all.configurations)
}
```
```terraform
# Filter by region and PostgreSQL version
data "beget_postgresql_configurations" "ru1_164" {
  region  = "ru1"
  version = "16.4"
}

output "ru1_164_summary" {
  value = {
    count  = length(data.beget_postgresql_configurations.ru1_164.configurations)
    sample = values(data.beget_postgresql_configurations.ru1_164.configurations)[0]
  }
}
```
<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Optional

- `region` (String) Filter configurations by region.
- `version` (String) Filter configurations by PostgreSQL version (e.g. 16.4).

### Read-Only

- `configurations` (Attributes Map) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--configurations))

<a id="nestedatt--configurations"></a>
### Nested Schema for `configurations`

Read-Only:

- `cpu_count` (Number)
- `disk_size` (Number)
- `display_version` (String)
- `id` (String)
- `memory` (Number)
- `price_day` (Number)
- `price_month` (Number)
- `region` (String)
- `type` (String)
- `version` (String)
